headline: Is Halliburton’s Recent 17% Rally Justified After New International Contract Wins?
summary: Wondering if Halliburton’s recent run-up means you’re late to the party or just in time? You’re not alone. It’s easy to see why the stock is back on investors’ radars. Up an impressive 17.4% in the last week and 5.7% in the past month, Halliburton has swiftly regained momentum after a rocky start to the year that saw shares down 4.3% year to date. Even taking a longer lens, the ups and downs stand out: a five-year gain of 126.1% contrasts sharply with a three-year dip of 22.2%. That...

headline: Halliburton (HAL) Q3 Earnings: Taking a Look at Key Metrics Versus Estimates
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Halliburton (HAL) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended September 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Oceaneering Q3 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Increase Y/Y
summary: OII expects 2025 adjusted EBITDA to be between $391 million and $401 million and is maintaining its full-year free cash flow guidance of $110 million to $130 million.

raw.headline: Oceaneering Q3 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Increase Y/Y
raw.summary: OII expects 2025 adjusted EBITDA to be between $391 million and $401 million and is maintaining its full-year free cash flow guidance of $110 million to $130 million.

headline: Halliburton Signs Framework Agreement for Umbilical-Less Tubing Hanger Installations
summary: HOUSTON, October 27, 2025--Halliburton (NYSE: HAL) signed a framework agreement to provide umbilical-less tubing hanger installation and retrieval services using the Remote Operated Control System (ROCS) technology to Shell. The agreement follows a successful three-well technology phase in the Gulf of America that highlights ROCS's effectiveness in deepwater environments.

headline: Halliburton (HAL) Rockets 19% on Upbeat International Outlook
summary: We recently published 10 of Wall Street’s Outperformers. Halliburton Company (NYSE:HAL) is one of the top-performing stocks last week. Halliburton saw its share prices jump by 19.22 percent week-on-week, with sentiment buoyed by an upbeat outlook for its international business despite recording a disappointing earnings performance in the third quarter of the year.
